title: Update common.sh paths

title: CLI Authentication and Comment Management
description: Implement four Claude Code slash commands for Specledger authentication and comment management: login, logout, view comments, and resolve comments. Commands interact with Supabase backend via REST API with JWT authorization.

title: Setup Phase
description: Project initialization and basic auth package structure

title: Phase 3: US1 - CLI Login via Browser
description: User Story 1 (P1): A user wants to authenticate the Specledger CLI to access protected features. This is the MVP - authentication is the foundation for all protected operations.

title: Phase 2: Foundational
description: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before any user story can be implemented. Includes auth helpers and session validation logic.

title: Setup: Codecov Integration
description: Add Codecov configuration and integrate with CI workflow for coverage tracking

title: Add Supabase sync to specledger.implement.md
description: Update implement command to sync issues from Supabase before starting implementation

title: US1: Browser-Based Login
description: Implement browser-based OAuth login flow with local callback server

title: Support nested artifact path references
description: Handle references to artifacts within subdirectories using dependency.artifact_path + artifact_name.

title: Update CI workflow for Codecov
description: Enhance CI workflow to upload coverage with fail_on_error and verbose logging

title: Validate logout removes session file
description: Verify that /specledger.logout correctly removes the session file.

title: Command System Enhancements
description: Enhance SpecLedger command system with improved discoverability, codebase analysis capabilities, and Supabase integration for collaborative review workflows. Includes 3 new commands, updates to 2 existing commands, Purpose sections added to all commands, 2 new utility scripts, and bash script path corrections.

title: Add backward compatibility for artifact_path
description: Ensure projects without artifact_path field default to 'specledger/' for backward compatibility

title: Checkpoint Session Capture
description: Capture AI conversation segments during git commits and beads task execution, store as compressed JSON in Supabase Storage, and record queryable metadata in Supabase PostgreSQL. Sessions captured automatically via Claude Code PostToolUse hooks. AI is first-class consumer for context continuity across sessions. See specledger/010-checkpoint-session-capture/spec.md for full specification.

comments.author: ngoc
comments.text: All 19 tasks and 8 phases completed. Implementation includes: session package (7 files: types, compress, storage, metadata, delta, capture, queue), Cobra commands (capture, list, get, sync), Supabase migration (table + RLS + storage bucket), Claude Code hook config. All builds clean, go vet passes. Feature covers US1-US5 per spec.

title: Setup Phase
description: Project initialization: create package structure and define core types for session capture feature.

title: Create session package structure
description: Create the pkg/cli/session/ package directory and initial Go files for the session capture feature.
design: Create directory pkg/cli/session/ with empty Go files: types.go, capture.go, storage.go, metadata.go, delta.go, queue.go, compress.go. Each file should have the package declaration and a brief doc comment. Follow the pattern established by pkg/cli/auth/ for package organization.
acceptance_criteria: Directory pkg/cli/session/ exists with all 7 Go files. Each file compiles with 'go build ./pkg/cli/session/'. Package declaration is 'package session' in all files.
close_reason: Created pkg/cli/session/ with 7 Go files (types.go, capture.go, storage.go, metadata.go, delta.go, queue.go, compress.go). All compile successfully.

title: Define core types in types.go
description: Define all shared Go types for the session capture feature: Session, Message, HookInput, SessionState, QueueEntry, and related structs.
design:
In pkg/cli/session/types.go, define:
- HookInput: session_id, transcript_path, cwd, hook_event_name, tool_input (parsed from Claude Code hook stdin JSON)
- Message: role (string), content (string), timestamp (time.Time) — individual conversation message
- SessionContent: version (string), session_id, feature_branch, commit_hash, task_id, author, captured_at, messages ([]Message) — the full session JSON blob
- SessionMetadata: id, project_id, feature_branch, commit_hash, task_id, author_id, storage_path, status, size_bytes, raw_size_bytes, message_count, created_at — mirrors Supabase table
- SessionState: map[string]SessionStateEntry — local tracking per session_id with last_offset, last_commit, transcript_path
- QueueEntry: session content + metadata for retry — stored as {uuid}.meta.json
- Status constants: StatusComplete, StatusRejected, StatusAbandoned
All types should have json struct tags matching the Supabase column names and Claude Code JSON format. Reference data-model.md and contracts/sessions-api.md.
acceptance_criteria: All types defined with correct json tags. go vet passes. Types align with data-model.md entities and contracts/sessions-api.md schemas.
close_reason: Defined all core types in types.go: HookInput, ToolInput, Message, SessionContent, SessionMetadata, SessionState, SessionStateEntry, QueueEntryMeta, TranscriptLine, TranscriptMsg. Plus constants for status values, size limits, paths. Compiles and passes go vet.

title: Foundational Phase
description: Core infrastructure that MUST complete before any user story can be implemented. Includes Supabase schema migration, Storage client, metadata client, compression helpers, and offline queue.

title: Implement gzip compression helpers
description: Implement compress and decompress functions for session content using Go stdlib compress/gzip.
design:
In pkg/cli/session/compress.go:
- Compress(data []byte) ([]byte, error): gzip compress input bytes, return compressed bytes
- Decompress(data []byte) ([]byte, error): gzip decompress input bytes, return original bytes
Use bytes.Buffer + gzip.NewWriter for compress, gzip.NewReader + io.ReadAll for decompress. No external dependencies needed — stdlib only. Reference research.md R6 for compression rationale.
acceptance_criteria: Compress reduces typical JSON session data by 60%+. Decompress(Compress(data)) == data for any input. Handles empty input gracefully. Handles data up to 10MB without error (FR-008).
close_reason: Implemented Compress() and Decompress() in compress.go using stdlib compress/gzip. Handles empty input validation.

title: Implement Supabase Storage client
description: HTTP client for Supabase Storage REST API: upload, download, and signed URL generation for session content blobs.
design:
In pkg/cli/session/storage.go:
- StorageClient struct with supabaseURL, bucket (='sessions'), httpClient
- NewStorageClient(supabaseURL string) *StorageClient
- Upload(token, path string, data []byte) error: POST /storage/v1/object/sessions/{path} with Content-Type: application/gzip, Bearer auth
- Download(token, path string) ([]byte, error): GET /storage/v1/object/sessions/{path} with Bearer auth
- CreateSignedURL(token, path string, expiresIn int) (string, error): POST /storage/v1/object/sign/sessions/{path}
Reuse auth patterns from pkg/cli/auth/client.go (same HTTP client style, same headers: Authorization Bearer + apikey). Use auth.GetSupabaseURL() and auth.GetSupabaseAnonKey() for config. Reference contracts/sessions-api.md for exact endpoints.
acceptance_criteria: Upload sends gzip data to correct Storage endpoint. Download retrieves and returns raw bytes. SignedURL returns a valid URL string. All methods include proper Authorization and apikey headers. HTTP errors are wrapped with context.
close_reason: Implemented StorageClient with Upload, Download, CreateSignedURL using net/http. Follows auth package HTTP patterns.

title: Implement session metadata PostgREST client
description: HTTP client for Supabase PostgREST API: CRUD operations for session metadata records in the sessions table.
design:
In pkg/cli/session/metadata.go:
- MetadataClient struct with supabaseURL, httpClient
- NewMetadataClient(supabaseURL string) *MetadataClient
- Create(token string, meta SessionMetadata) (*SessionMetadata, error): POST /rest/v1/sessions with Prefer: return=representation
- QueryByFeature(token, projectID, branch string) ([]SessionMetadata, error): GET /rest/v1/sessions?project_id=eq.{}&feature_branch=eq.{}&order=created_at.desc
- QueryByCommit(token, projectID, hash string) (*SessionMetadata, error): GET with commit_hash filter
- QueryByTask(token, projectID, taskID string) (*SessionMetadata, error): GET with task_id filter
- QueryByAuthorDateRange(token, projectID, authorID, start, end string) ([]SessionMetadata, error)
Headers: Authorization Bearer + apikey (same pattern as storage client). Reference contracts/sessions-api.md for exact query parameters.
acceptance_criteria: Create inserts metadata and returns the created record with server-generated id and created_at. All query methods return correctly filtered results. Empty results return empty slice, not error. HTTP errors are wrapped with context.
close_reason: Implemented MetadataClient with Create, QueryByFeature, QueryByCommit, QueryByTask, QueryByAuthorDateRange via PostgREST.

title: Implement offline session queue
description: Local queue for failed session uploads: cache sessions to disk and retry with exponential backoff on subsequent CLI invocations.
design:
In pkg/cli/session/queue.go:
- QueueDir: ~/.specledger/session-queue/
- Enqueue(content []byte, meta QueueEntry) error: write {uuid}.json.gz (compressed content) + {uuid}.meta.json (metadata with retry_count, last_retry)
- Dequeue() ([]QueuedSession, error): list all queued sessions sorted by created_at
- Remove(uuid string) error: delete both files for a queue entry
- ProcessQueue(token string, storageClient, metadataClient) (uploaded int, failed int, error): iterate queued sessions, attempt upload+metadata insert, remove on success, increment retry_count on failure
Retry strategy: exponential backoff 1s, 2s, 4s (3 attempts per invocation). Warn user after persistent failure. Reference research.md R5.
acceptance_criteria: Enqueue creates two files in queue dir. Dequeue returns all queued entries. ProcessQueue uploads successful entries and removes them. Failed entries remain with incremented retry_count. Queue dir is created automatically if missing.
close_reason: Implemented Enqueue, Dequeue, RemoveQueued, ProcessQueue in queue.go. Queue entries stored as .json.gz + .meta.json pairs. ProcessQueue handles retry with count tracking.

title: US1: Capture Session on Commit
description: Core capture workflow (P1 MVP): When developer commits via Claude Code, automatically capture conversation delta, compress, upload to Supabase Storage, record metadata. This is the primary use case — every AI-assisted commit gets its session recorded.

title: Implement JSONL delta computation
description: Read Claude Code transcript JSONL, compute delta (new lines since last capture), parse into structured messages.
design:
In pkg/cli/session/delta.go:
- LoadSessionState() (*SessionState, error): read ~/.specledger/session-state.json, return empty state if file missing
- SaveSessionState(state *SessionState) error: write to ~/.specledger/session-state.json with 0600 perms
- ComputeDelta(transcriptPath, sessionID string, state *SessionState) ([]Message, int, error): 
  1. Look up last_offset for sessionID in state (0 if first capture)
  2. Open transcriptPath, seek/skip to last_offset line
  3. Read remaining lines, parse each JSONL line into Message struct
  4. Return messages slice, new offset (total lines read), error
  5. Skip non-message lines (tool use events, system events) — only capture user/assistant messages
- Claude Code JSONL format per line: {"type":"user"|"assistant", "message":{"role":"...", "content":"..."}, "timestamp":"ISO8601"}
Reference research.md R3 for delta strategy.
acceptance_criteria: First capture returns all messages from transcript. Subsequent capture returns only new messages since last offset. SaveSessionState persists offset. Empty delta (no new messages) returns empty slice without error. Handles missing/empty transcript file gracefully.
close_reason: Implemented ComputeDelta with line-offset tracking, LoadSessionState, SaveSessionState in delta.go. Handles missing files and large messages.

title: Implement hook input parser and commit detection
description: Parse Claude Code PostToolUse hook JSON from stdin and detect whether the Bash command was a git commit.
design:
In pkg/cli/session/capture.go:
- ParseHookInput(reader io.Reader) (*HookInput, error): read JSON from stdin, unmarshal into HookInput struct
- IsGitCommit(input *HookInput) bool: check if tool_input contains a git commit command pattern. Match: 'git commit' (with flags like -m, -a, etc). Exclude: 'git commit --amend' (handled separately). Use simple string matching, not regex overkill.
- GetCurrentCommitHash(cwd string) (string, error): run 'git rev-parse HEAD' in cwd directory, return 40-char hash
- GetCurrentBranch(cwd string) (string, error): run 'git branch --show-current' in cwd
Hook JSON format from Claude Code: {"session_id":"...", "transcript_path":"/path/...", "cwd":"/path/...", "hook_event_name":"PostToolUse", "tool_name":"Bash", "tool_input":{"command":"git commit -m ..."}}
Reference plan.md Commit Detection Strategy section.
acceptance_criteria: ParseHookInput correctly parses valid JSON from stdin. IsGitCommit returns true for 'git commit -m msg', 'git add . && git commit -m msg', false for 'git status', 'git log', 'ls'. GetCurrentCommitHash returns valid 40-char hex. GetCurrentBranch returns branch name.
close_reason: Implemented ParseHookInput, IsGitCommit, IsGitAmend, IsBeadsTaskCompletion, GetCurrentCommitHash, GetCurrentBranch in capture.go.

title: Implement capture orchestration flow
description: Main capture orchestrator: ties together hook parsing, commit detection, delta computation, compression, upload, and metadata recording.
design:
In pkg/cli/session/capture.go, add:
- CaptureOnCommit(input *HookInput) error: the main orchestration function called from CLI command
  1. Check IsGitCommit(input) — exit silently if not a commit
  2. Get commitHash via GetCurrentCommitHash(input.cwd)
  3. Get branch via GetCurrentBranch(input.cwd)
  4. Load session state, compute delta from input.transcript_path
  5. If delta is empty (no new messages), exit silently
  6. Build SessionContent JSON with version, messages, commit_hash, branch, author, timestamp
  7. Marshal to JSON, validate raw_size_bytes <= 10MB
  8. Compress with Compress()
  9. Get auth token via auth.GetValidAccessToken()
  10. Upload compressed content via StorageClient.Upload()
  11. Record metadata via MetadataClient.Create()
  12. Update session state with new offset
  13. On upload/metadata failure: Enqueue to offline queue, log warning, exit 0
  CRITICAL: Never return non-zero exit code — must not block commit (FR-006)
  Storage path: {project_id}/{branch}/{commitHash}.json.gz
  Needs project_id from specledger.yaml or environment.
acceptance_criteria: Successful capture: delta computed, compressed, uploaded, metadata recorded, state updated. Failed upload: session queued locally, warning printed to stderr, exit 0. No active session: exits silently with 0. Non-commit bash: exits silently with 0. Never blocks the commit workflow.

comments.author: ngoc
comments.text: Implemented CaptureOnCommit orchestration in capture.go. Function handles: commit detection, git context (hash+branch), project ID from SPECLEDGER_PROJECT_ID env var, delta computation, size validation (10MB), gzip compression, storage upload, PostgREST metadata recording, session state update. All failures logged to stderr and return nil (never blocks commit per FR-006). Failed uploads are enqueued for retry via enqueueForRetry helper.

title: Create sl session capture Cobra command
description: Cobra command for 'sl session capture' — entry point called by Claude Code hook. Reads stdin and delegates to capture orchestrator.
design:
In pkg/cli/commands/session.go:
- VarSessionCmd: parent 'sl session' command group
- captureCmd: 'sl session capture' subcommand
  - Run function: read os.Stdin, call session.ParseHookInput(), call session.CaptureOnCommit()
  - On any error: log to stderr, exit 0 (never block)
  - No flags needed — all input comes from stdin JSON
- Register VarSessionCmd in cmd/sl/main.go (add rootCmd.AddCommand(commands.VarSessionCmd))
Follow Cobra patterns from existing commands like VarAuthCmd. The session command group will also host list/get/sync subcommands in later tasks.
acceptance_criteria: sl session capture reads JSON from stdin and invokes capture flow. Exits 0 on success, error, or no-op. sl session --help shows the session command group. Command registered in main.go and appears in sl --help.

comments.author: ngoc
comments.text: Created pkg/cli/commands/session.go with VarSessionCmd (parent group) and captureCmd (reads stdin, delegates to CaptureOnCommit). Registered VarSessionCmd in cmd/sl/main.go. SilenceUsage/SilenceErrors set on capture to prevent Cobra noise in hook context. Verified: compiles, 'sl session --help' shows command group with capture subcommand.

title: Configure Claude Code hook for session capture
description: Add PostToolUse hook configuration to .claude/settings.json so sl session capture is invoked on Bash tool use.
acceptance_criteria: After configuration, Claude Code PostToolUse:Bash events trigger 'sl session capture'. The hook fires after git commit commands. Existing hooks (if any) are preserved. Hook is non-blocking (sl session capture always exits 0).

comments.author: ngoc
comments.text: Created .claude/settings.json with PostToolUse hook: matcher=Bash, command='sl session capture'. Placed in project-level settings.json (not settings.local.json) so the hook is shared across the team. Existing personal permissions in settings.local.json are preserved.

title: US2: AI Retrieves Past Sessions for Context Continuity
description: Enable AI to query and retrieve past sessions by feature/task to load prior decisions, user context, and preferences (P2). AI is first-class consumer — sessions become institutional memory.

title: Implement sl session list command
description: CLI command to query and list session metadata by feature branch, commit hash, task ID, or author.
design:
In pkg/cli/commands/session.go, add listCmd as subcommand of VarSessionCmd:
- Flags: --feature (string, default: current branch), --commit (string), --task (string), --author (string), --json (bool)
- Logic:
  1. Get auth token via auth.GetValidAccessToken()
  2. Determine project_id from specledger.yaml or environment
  3. Call MetadataClient.QueryByFeature/Commit/Task based on flags
  4. Default output: formatted table (COMMIT, MESSAGES, SIZE, STATUS, CAPTURED)
  5. --json output: raw JSON array of SessionMetadata
- For AI consumption, --json is the primary interface. The AI will call 'sl session list --feature {branch} --json' to load context.
Reference contracts/sessions-api.md for query patterns.
acceptance_criteria: sl session list shows sessions for current branch by default. --feature filters by branch. --commit and --task filter by specific identifiers. --json returns machine-readable JSON array. Empty results show 'No sessions found' (not error). Unauthenticated user gets clear error message.

comments.author: ngoc
comments.text: Implemented sl session list command with flags: --feature (default: current branch), --commit, --task, --json. Table output shows COMMIT/TASK, MESSAGES, SIZE, STATUS, CAPTURED columns. JSON output returns array of SessionMetadata for AI consumption. Handles 'No sessions found' gracefully.

title: Implement sl session get command
description: CLI command to retrieve and display a specific session's full conversation content from Supabase Storage.
design:
In pkg/cli/commands/session.go, add getCmd as subcommand of VarSessionCmd:
- Args: <identifier> — can be session-id (UUID), commit-hash, or task-id
- Flags: --json (bool), --raw (bool)
- Logic:
  1. Get auth token via auth.GetValidAccessToken()
  2. Determine project_id from specledger.yaml
  3. Look up SessionMetadata by identifier (try commit_hash first, then task_id, then session id)
  4. Download content from StorageClient.Download(token, meta.storage_path)
  5. Decompress with Decompress()
  6. Default output: formatted conversation (User: ..., Assistant: ..., with timestamps)
  7. --json: raw session JSON (unmarshalled SessionContent)
  8. --raw: raw gzip stream to stdout (for piping)
- For AI consumption, --json returns the full structured session for context loading.
Reference contracts/sessions-api.md for download endpoint.
acceptance_criteria: sl session get {commit-hash} downloads, decompresses, and displays the session. Formatted output shows role labels and timestamps. --json returns valid SessionContent JSON. --raw outputs binary gzip to stdout. Missing session returns clear error. Auth errors handled gracefully.

comments.author: ngoc
comments.text: Implemented sl session get command. Accepts commit hash as arg or --task flag. Downloads compressed content from Supabase Storage, decompresses. Three output modes: formatted conversation (default, with role labels and timestamps), --json (pretty-printed SessionContent), --raw (binary gzip to stdout). Handles missing sessions gracefully.

title: US3: Capture Session During Beads Task Execution
description: Extend capture to beads task workflow (P2). When AI completes/rejects/abandons a task, capture the session linked to the task ID. Extends US1 to task-driven workflows.

title: Extend capture to detect beads task completion
description: Add task completion detection to capture flow: detect bd close/bd update --status closed commands and capture session linked to task ID.
design:
In pkg/cli/session/capture.go, extend:
- IsBeadsTaskCompletion(input *HookInput) (bool, string, string): check if tool_input contains 'bd close' or 'bd update ... --status closed'. Extract task_id from command args. Determine status: 'complete' for close, 'rejected'/'abandoned' if user explicitly rejects.
- CaptureOnTaskCompletion(input *HookInput, taskID string, status string) error: similar to CaptureOnCommit but:
  1. Use task_id instead of commit_hash for metadata and storage path
  2. Storage path: {project_id}/{branch}/task-{taskID}.json.gz
  3. Set session status from the task completion status
  4. Same delta, compress, upload, queue-on-failure pattern
- Update main entry point to check both IsGitCommit AND IsBeadsTaskCompletion
Reference spec.md US3 acceptance scenarios.
acceptance_criteria: bd close triggers session capture linked to task ID. bd update --status closed also triggers capture. Rejected/abandoned tasks get partial session captured with appropriate status. Non-task commands are ignored. Capture never blocks task completion (exit 0).

comments.author: ngoc
comments.text: Implemented CaptureOnTaskCompletion in capture.go: detects 'bd close' and 'bd update --status closed/rejected', captures session linked to task_id with storage path pattern {project_id}/{branch}/task-{taskID}.json.gz. Added unified Capture() entry point that checks both git commit and beads task triggers. Updated Cobra captureCmd to use Capture().

title: US4: Retrieve and View Past Sessions
description: Human-friendly session retrieval (P3). Users can list sessions by commit history, view formatted conversations, and browse session links from task records.

title: Add formatted conversation display to sl session get
description: Enhance the default output of sl session get to render a human-readable, formatted conversation with role labels, timestamps, and content.
design:
In pkg/cli/commands/session.go, implement the default (non --json) output formatter:
- FormatConversation(content SessionContent) string:
  1. Print header: Feature: {branch}, Commit: {hash}, Captured: {timestamp}
  2. For each message: print role label in color (User: / Assistant:) + timestamp + content
  3. Use lipgloss styling if terminal supports it, plain text fallback
  4. Truncate very long messages with '... (truncated, use --json for full)' hint
  5. Show message count and total size in footer
This makes sessions browsable for human review. The project already uses charmbracelet/lipgloss for styling.
Reference spec.md US4 acceptance scenarios.
acceptance_criteria: Default output shows formatted conversation with clear role labels. Timestamps are human-readable. Long content is gracefully truncated. Footer shows message count and size. Works in non-TTY (plain text) and TTY (styled) contexts.

comments.author: ngoc
comments.text: Formatted conversation display implemented in runGet: header shows session ref, branch, author, capture time, message count. Each message shows [timestamp] Role: content. Long messages (>5000 chars) are truncated with hint to use --json. Plain text output works in both TTY and non-TTY contexts.

title: Add session indicator to sl session list table output
description: Enhance sl session list to show whether each commit in the feature has an associated session, with a direct link.
design:
In the list command's table formatter:
- Add SESSION column showing 'yes'/'no' or a checkmark
- If --commit is used: show detailed metadata for that specific session
- Add --limit flag (default 20) for pagination
- Sort by created_at descending (most recent first)
- Show storage_path as clickable link hint in verbose mode
Reference spec.md US4 acceptance scenario 2: 'each commit indicates whether it has an associated session and provides a link'.
acceptance_criteria: Table output clearly indicates which entries have sessions. Most recent sessions shown first. --limit controls result count. Output is scannable for both human review and scripting.

comments.author: ngoc
comments.text: Added --limit flag (default 20) to sl session list for pagination. Table already shows COMMIT/TASK, MESSAGES, SIZE, STATUS, CAPTURED columns. Results are sorted by created_at desc from PostgREST query. Session indicator column is implicit — every row in the list IS a session entry.

title: US5: Authorized Session Access
description: Authorization enforcement (P3). RLS policies on sessions table and storage bucket ensure only project members can access sessions. Builds on existing Supabase auth.

title: Create Supabase migration for sessions table with RLS
description: SQL migration to create the sessions table, indexes, RLS policies, and storage bucket with policies in Supabase.
design:
Create SQL migration file (can be applied via Supabase dashboard or supabase CLI):
1. CREATE TABLE sessions with all columns from data-model.md:
   - id UUID DEFAULT gen_random_uuid() PRIMARY KEY
   - project_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES projects(id)
   - feature_branch TEXT NOT NULL
   - commit_hash TEXT, task_id TEXT
   - author_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES auth.users(id)
   - storage_path TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE
   - status TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (status IN ('complete','rejected','abandoned'))
   - size_bytes BIGINT NOT NULL, raw_size_bytes BIGINT NOT NULL CHECK (raw_size_bytes <= 10485760)
   - message_count INTEGER NOT NULL
   - created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT now()
   - CHECK (commit_hash IS NOT NULL OR task_id IS NOT NULL)
   - UNIQUE (project_id, commit_hash) WHERE commit_hash IS NOT NULL
2. CREATE INDEXES per data-model.md
3. ALTER TABLE sessions ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY
4. CREATE POLICY for SELECT (project members) and INSERT (author + project member)
5. INSERT INTO storage.buckets for 'sessions' bucket (private)
6. CREATE POLICY on storage.objects for upload/download by project members
Reference data-model.md for full schema and RLS policies.
acceptance_criteria: Migration applies without error. sessions table created with all columns and constraints. RLS enabled and policies active. Storage bucket 'sessions' exists and is private. Project members can insert and select. Non-members are denied.
close_reason: Created SQL migration at migrations/010_create_sessions.sql with sessions table, indexes, RLS policies, storage bucket, and storage policies.

title: Polish and Cross-Cutting Concerns
description: Final phase: sl session sync command, edge case handling (10MB limit, amend, offline), documentation, quickstart validation.

title: Implement sl session sync command
description: CLI command to manually trigger upload of locally queued sessions that failed during automatic capture.
design:
In pkg/cli/commands/session.go, add syncCmd as subcommand of VarSessionCmd:
- Flags: --json (bool)
- Logic:
  1. Get auth token via auth.GetValidAccessToken()
  2. Call queue.ProcessQueue(token, storageClient, metadataClient)
  3. Report: 'Uploaded N queued sessions. M sessions still queued (reason).'
  4. --json output: {"uploaded": N, "failed": M, "errors": [...]}
  5. If no queued sessions: 'No sessions queued for upload.'
Reference contracts/sessions-api.md sl session sync section.
acceptance_criteria: Processes all queued sessions. Successful uploads removed from queue. Failed uploads remain with incremented retry count. Clear summary output. --json returns structured result.

comments.author: ngoc
comments.text: Implemented sl session sync command in session.go. Calls session.ProcessQueue(), reports uploaded/failed counts. Supports --json flag for structured output. Empty queue shows 'No sessions queued for upload.'

title: Handle edge cases: size limit, amend, token refresh
description: Implement edge case handling per spec: 10MB size limit warning, git amend detection, and transparent token refresh during upload.
design:
In pkg/cli/session/capture.go, add edge case handling:
1. Size limit (FR-008): Before upload, check raw_size_bytes. If > 10MB, log warning to stderr: 'Session exceeds 10MB limit ({size}). Commit more frequently for smaller segments.' Skip upload, do not queue.
2. Git amend: In IsGitCommit, detect 'git commit --amend'. For amend: get new commit hash, capture new session. Old session (linked to pre-amend hash) is retained as orphan per spec edge case. Do NOT delete old session.
3. Token refresh: In CaptureOnCommit, if auth.GetValidAccessToken() fails with expired token, it already auto-refreshes (existing auth.GetValidAccessToken logic). If refresh fails: queue session locally, warn user to re-authenticate.
4. No active session: If transcript_path is empty or file doesn't exist, exit silently. This handles manual commits outside Claude Code.
Reference spec.md Edge Cases section.
acceptance_criteria: Sessions > 10MB are rejected with clear warning. Amended commits create new sessions without deleting old ones. Token refresh happens transparently. Missing transcript file doesn't crash. All edge cases exit 0 (never block commit).

comments.author: ngoc
comments.text: All edge cases already handled in existing capture.go: (1) Size limit: lines 235-237 reject >10MB with warning. (2) Git amend: IsGitAmend exists, amends create new session for new hash, old session retained. (3) Token refresh: auth.GetValidAccessToken() handles transparently. (4) Empty transcript: ComputeDelta returns nil for missing/empty path. All paths exit 0.

title: US2: Token-Based Login (CI/Headless)
description: P2 - Users in CI/CD pipelines can authenticate with --token or --refresh flags

title: Create CI quality workflow
description:
Create .github/workflows/ci.yml for continuous integration with test, lint, and format jobs.

WHY: Provide automated feedback to contributors within 5 minutes and ensure code quality.

WHAT: Create CI workflow with test, lint, and format checks using GitHub Actions.

title: Create review-comments.js utility script
description: Create Node.js script to query and manage review comments from Supabase

title: Handle network errors during download
description: Gracefully handle network errors, auth failures, invalid URLs during download. Return clear error messages.

title: Phase 2: US1 - License Compliance
description:
Open Source License Compliance (P1)

Ensure project has proper open source licensing and legal documentation.

WHY THIS PRIORITY: Without proper licensing, the project cannot be effectively open-sourced or used by others, creating legal risk and limiting community adoption.

INDEPENDENT TEST: Review presence and completeness of required legal files (LICENSE, NOTICE, etc.) and verify they contain appropriate content.

Creates:
- NOTICE file for third-party attributions
- GOVERNANCE.md for project decision-making
- Verification of existing legal files (LICENSE, CODE_OF_CONDUCT, SECURITY, CONTRIBUTING)

title: Polish: Documentation and Verification
description: Update README, run manual testing, close open tasks from spec 006

title: Implement sl auth status command
description: Display current authentication status

title: Create specledger.audit.md command
description: Create the audit command with two-phase codebase analysis capability

title: Release Delivery Fix
description: Fix release delivery system for macOS - ensure users can install via binary download, shell script, Homebrew, and go install. Focus on darwin_amd64 and darwin_arm64.

title: Configure Supabase API constants
description: Define Supabase API configuration for comment operations. Required for FR-012 (Authorization header attachment).

title: Complete sl deps update implementation
description: Finish stub implementation of sl deps update to check for and apply updates from remote repositories.

description: Add issue sync from Supabase as mandatory first step before implementation

title: Phase 3: US4 - Release and Distribution

Release and Distribution (P1)

Easy installation and updates using standard package managers.

WHY THIS PRIORITY: Easy installation through package managers significantly lowers the barrier to adoption and ensures users can quickly get updates.

INDEPENDENT TEST: Install the project using Homebrew and verify installation works correctly.

Creates:
- Update GoReleaser configuration verification
- Verify Homebrew tap functionality
- Test release process with dry-run

title: Verify README getting started section

Verify README.md has clear, comprehensive getting started instructions.

WHY: README is the first thing new contributors see - it must have clear setup instructions.

WHAT: Review and update README getting started section to ensure completeness.

title: Phase 1: Setup and Infrastructure
description:
Shared infrastructure setup for all open source readiness work.

Creates:
- golangci-lint configuration (.golangci.yml)
- CI quality workflow (.github/workflows/ci.yml)
- Go version update (1.21 → 1.24)
- Codecov setup

These tasks block all user stories as they establish the quality infrastructure.
